sentences.en: He conferred with Hill and the others in his office.
sentences.cn: 他和希尔以及他办公室里的其他人进行了商议。

sentences.en: He listened in silence, and finally promised to confer with the physician.
sentences.cn: 他默默不语地听着, 终于答应和医生谈谈看.

sentences.en: He wanted to confer with his colleagues before reaching a decision.
sentences.cn: 他想与他的同事先商议一下再作出决定。

sentences.en: He withdrew to confer with his teacher before announcing a decision.
sentences.cn: 他先去请教他的老师然后再宣布决定.

sentences.en: I'll confer with him on the subject.
If it once became general, wealth would confer no distinction.
sentences.cn: 财富一旦普及,它就不分彼此.

sentences.en: It is now generally granted that the modified nucleosides do confer special properties.
sentences.cn: 现在一般认为,更改过的核苷确实带来特殊的性质.

sentences.en: Money, in whatever hands, will confer power.
sentences.cn: 金钱不论在谁手里总会带来权力.

sentences.en: She withdrew to confer with her advisers before announcing a decision.
sentences.cn: 她先去请教顾问然后再宣布决定.

sentences.en: That guilt , though it may attain temporal splendor , can never confer real happiness.
sentences.cn: 犯罪的人纵能荣耀一时, 却不能得到真正的幸福.

sentences.en: The constitution also confers large powers on Brazil's 25 constituent states.
sentences.cn: 宪法还授予巴西25个成员州极大的权力。

sentences.en: Then Moy would come and confer with him and there would be the devil to pay.
sentences.cn: 接着莫埃就会来和他商量,这一来他的前途就不堪设想了.

sentences.en: There were a few people whom Mr. Dempster wished to confer with.
sentences.cn: 登普斯特先生想要与几个人商议一下.

sentences.en: They were empowered by the King to confer upon Macbeth the dignity of thane of Cawdor.
sentences.cn: 他们奉国王的命令封麦克白作考特爵士.

sentences.en: When I have learned more, I must confer at once with Arbaces.
sentences.cn: 等我知道得再多一点儿, 我就得马上跟阿耳巴刻斯商量对策.

trans.tran_en: to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved
to discuss something with other people, so that everyone can express their opinions and decide on something
to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved
